wikipedia_page.main: John Neville Manners (6 January 1892 – 1 September 1914) played cricket for Eton College in Fowler's match in 1910, and died in the early weeks of the First World War on the retreat from Mons.  He was immortalised in poem LIV of The Muse in Arms by William Grenfell (brother of Julian Grenfell) entitled "To John".
